perturbation.original_text: 5.7 Payment Schedule. The parties shall make such payments within ----------------- thirty (30) days of the end of each calendar quarter for the Advertising Revenue invoiced during such calendar quarter.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.7 Payment Schedule. The parties shall make such payments within ----------------- ninety (90) days of the end of each calendar quarter for the Advertising Revenue invoiced during such calendar quarter.
perturbation.explanation: This change extends the payment period to 90 days. California law generally favors shorter payment terms, especially for smaller businesses or independent contractors. While not a direct violation, unreasonably extending payment terms could be challenged, particularly if it imposes a significant financial burden on NETTAXI, which is implied to be the smaller business receiving payments from SpinRecords.com. California Prompt Payment laws favor businesses being paid in a reasonable time frame. If NETTAXI is a small business this can be more problematic
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Prompt Payment Laws (though not directly violated, the extended term could be challenged)

perturbation.original_text: Upon written demand of the Disclosing Party, the Receiving Party shall cease using the Confidential Source: RAE SYSTEMS INC, 10-Q, 11/14/2000 Information and return the Confidential Information and all copies, notes or extracts thereof to the Disclosing Party within seven (7) days of receipt of notice.
perturbation.changed_text: Upon written demand of the Disclosing Party, the Receiving Party shall cease using the Confidential Source: RAE SYSTEMS INC, 10-Q, 11/14/2000 Information and return the Confidential Information and all copies, notes or extracts thereof to the Disclosing Party within two (2) days of receipt of notice.
perturbation.explanation: California law, specifically the California Uniform Trade Secrets Act (CUTSA), requires reasonable measures to protect trade secrets. Mandating the return of confidential information within just two days of notice may be deemed commercially unreasonable in certain cases, especially if the Receiving Party needs more time to fully purge its systems and ensure complete compliance. This haste might be viewed as an insufficient allowance to properly comply with trade secret protection requirements, especially if there's a substantial amount of data involved, potentially putting the Receiving Party at risk of inadvertent disclosure while trying to comply quickly.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Uniform Trade Secrets Act (CUTSA) - reasonableness standard for protecting trade secrets.

perturbation.original_text: 5.8 Records. SpinRecords.com agrees to keep accurate books of account ------- and records at its principal place of business covering all Advertising Revenues and associated commissions. Upon reasonable notice of not less than seven (7) business days, but in no event more than once per year (unless the immediately preceding audit showed a material underpayment), NETTAXI shall have the right, subject to suitable confidentiality measures, to cause a certified public accountant to inspect those portions of the books of account and records which relate to the royalties owed NETTAXI, to confirm that the correct amount owing NETTAXI under this Agreement has been paid. SpinRecords.com shall maintain such books of account and records which support each statement for at least two years after the termination or expiration of this contract or after the final payment made by SpinRecords.com to NETTAXI, whichever is later.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.8 Records. SpinRecords.com agrees to keep accurate books of account ------- and records at its principal place of business covering all Advertising Revenues and associated commissions. NETTAXI shall have the right, subject to suitable confidentiality measures, to cause a certified public accountant to inspect those portions of the books of account and records which relate to the royalties owed NETTAXI, to confirm that the correct amount owing NETTAXI under this Agreement has been paid, only upon written notice no less than 3 business days. SpinRecords.com shall maintain such books of account and records which support each statement for at least six months after the termination or expiration of this contract or after the final payment made by SpinRecords.com to NETTAXI, whichever is later.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the advance notice for audits to 3 business days and decreasing the record retention period to six months creates a potential conflict with general principles of contract law and accounting standards. While California doesn't have a specific statute mandating a minimum record retention period for contracts of this nature, generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) and prudent business practices suggest longer retention periods, particularly for financial records related to revenue and royalty payments. A shorter retention period of six months could impede NETTAXI's ability to verify payments accurately in the event of disputes and may conflict with industry standards for financial audits, as NETTAXI only has a 3-day heads up.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) and industry standards for financial audits; general contract law principles regarding reasonable access to records.
